ENTRY.refkeywords: filter filters ignore notice ignore notice
ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Return the filter of a data set

DESC.PARA: The get_filter() function returns the filter expression of a data set resulting from the application of the ignore() or notice() filter functions. In other words, this function returns the range of data being considered in the analysis of a specified data set, by data id.

LIST.ITEM: id - the id of the data set to use; if not given, uses the default dataset id (id=1 by default, see "ahelp get_default_id")

DESC.PARA: When called with no arguments, get_filter() returns the filter expression of the default data set.
If supplied with a data set ID, get_filter() returns the range of data included in the analysis of the specified data set.
